section.name: Linear regression models
section.topText: A normal linear model explains how the distribution of a response variable, Y, depends on an explanatory variable, X.
section.page: Some bivariate data sets describe complete populations. Others are 'representative' of an underlying population or process.
The response is often modelled with a normal distribution whose mean is a linear function of X and whose standard deviation is constant.
The normal linear model has 3 unknown parameters. For many data sets, these parameters have meaningful interpretations.
